## ResX Code Generation
*Autogenerated by MFractor v3.4.7*
## Generate C# ResX Resource Lookup

**Configuration Id: com.mfractor.code_gen.resx.generate_csharp_resx_lookup**

Generates C# resource lookup such as `MyApp.Resources.Resources.MyLabel`


## Generate ResX Entry

**Configuration Id: com.mfractor.code_gen.resx.generate_resx_entry**

Generates a single ResX resource entry element containing the key, value and comment.


### Configurable Properties

| Name | Type | Defaults To | Description |
|------|------|-------------|-------------|
| **IncludeCommentWhenEmpty** | Boolean | False | When no comment for the new ResX entry has been provided, should an empty comment tag be included? |

## Generate ResX File

**Configuration Id: com.mfractor.code_gen.resx.resx_file**

Generates a new ResX file


### Configurable Properties

| Name | Type | Defaults To | Description |
|------|------|-------------|-------------|
| **ResXTemplate** | `Code Snippet` | <code><?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><br/><root><br/>  <!-- <br/>    Microsoft ResX Schema <br/>    <br/>    Version 2.0<br/>    <br/>    The primary goals of this format is to allow a simple XML format <br/>    that is mostly human readable. The generation and parsing of the <br/>    various data types are done through the TypeConverter classes <br/>    associated with the data types.<br/>    <br/>    Example:<br/>    <br/>    ... ado.net/XML headers & schema ...<br/>    <resheader name="resmimetype">text/microsoft-resx</resheader><br/>    <resheader name="version">2.0</resheader><br/>    <resheader name="reader">System.Resources.ResXResourceReader, System.Windows.Forms, ...</resheader><br/>    <resheader name="writer">System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter, System.Windows.Forms, ...</resheader><br/>    <data name="Name1"><value>this is my long string</value><comment>this is a comment</comment></data><br/>    <data name="Color1" type="System.Drawing.Color, System.Drawing">Blue</data><br/>    <data name="Bitmap1" mimetype="application/x-microsoft.net.object.binary.base64"><br/>        <value>[base64 mime encoded serialized .NET Framework object]</value><br/>    </data><br/>    <data name="Icon1" type="System.Drawing.Icon, System.Drawing" mimetype="application/x-microsoft.net.object.bytearray.base64"><br/>        <value>[base64 mime encoded string representing a byte array form of the .NET Framework object]</value><br/>        <comment>This is a comment</comment><br/>    </data><br/>                <br/>    There are any number of "resheader" rows that contain simple <br/>    name/value pairs.<br/>    <br/>    Each data row contains a name, and value. The row also contains a <br/>    type or mimetype. Type corresponds to a .NET class that support <br/>    text/value conversion through the TypeConverter architecture. <br/>    Classes that don't support this are serialized and stored with the <br/>    mimetype set.<br/>    <br/>    The mimetype is used for serialized objects, and tells the <br/>    ResXResourceReader how to depersist the object. This is currently not <br/>    extensible. For a given mimetype the value must be set accordingly:<br/>    <br/>    Note - application/x-microsoft.net.object.binary.base64 is the format <br/>    that the ResXResourceWriter will generate, however the reader can <br/>    read any of the formats listed below.<br/>    <br/>    mimetype: application/x-microsoft.net.object.binary.base64<br/>    value   : The object must be serialized with <br/>            : System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter<br/>            : and then encoded with base64 encoding.<br/>    <br/>    mimetype: application/x-microsoft.net.object.soap.base64<br/>    value   : The object must be serialized with <br/>            : System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Soap.SoapFormatter<br/>            : and then encoded with base64 encoding.<br/><br/>    mimetype: application/x-microsoft.net.object.bytearray.base64<br/>    value   : The object must be serialized into a byte array <br/>            : using a System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter<br/>            : and then encoded with base64 encoding.<br/>    --><br/>  <xsd:schema id="root" xmlns="" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:msdata="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:xml-msdata"><br/>    <xsd:import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" /><br/>    <xsd:element name="root" msdata:IsDataSet="true"><br/>      <xsd:complexType><br/>        <xsd:choice maxOccurs="unbounded"><br/>          <xsd:element name="metadata"><br/>            <xsd:complexType><br/>              <xsd:sequence><br/>                <xsd:element name="value" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" /><br/>              </xsd:sequence><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="name" use="required" type="xsd:string" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="type" type="xsd:string" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="mimetype" type="xsd:string" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute ref="xml:space" /><br/>            </xsd:complexType><br/>          </xsd:element><br/>          <xsd:element name="assembly"><br/>            <xsd:complexType><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="alias" type="xsd:string" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" /><br/>            </xsd:complexType><br/>          </xsd:element><br/>          <xsd:element name="data"><br/>            <xsd:complexType><br/>              <xsd:sequence><br/>                <xsd:element name="value" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" msdata:Ordinal="1" /><br/>                <xsd:element name="comment" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" msdata:Ordinal="2" /><br/>              </xsd:sequence><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="name" type="xsd:string" use="required" msdata:Ordinal="1" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="type" type="xsd:string" msdata:Ordinal="3" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute name="mimetype" type="xsd:string" msdata:Ordinal="4" /><br/>              <xsd:attribute ref="xml:space" /><br/>            </xsd:complexType><br/>          </xsd:element><br/>          <xsd:element name="resheader"><br/>            <xsd:complexType><br/>              <xsd:sequence><br/> use="required" /><br/>            </xsd:complexType><br/>          </xsd:element><br/>        </xsd:choice><br/>      </xsd:complexType><br/>    </xsd:element><br/>  </xsd:schema><br/>  <resheader name="resmimetype"><br/>    <value>text/microsoft-resx</value><br/>  </resheader><br/>  <resheader name="version"><br/>    <value>2.0</value><br/>  </resheader><br/>  <resheader name="reader"><br/> .resx file template. |
